metadata.description: Direct income support scheme for landholding farmers across India, providing ₹6,000/year via DBT.

embedding_text: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN). Direct income support scheme for landholding farmers across India, providing ₹6,000 per year paid in 3 installments of ₹2,000 every four months via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT). Objective: Provide financial support to all eligible landholding farmer families to supplement their income and encourage sustainable agriculture. Benefits: ₹6,000 per year, paid in three installments directly to the beneficiary's bank account through DBT. Eligibility: All landholding farmer families with cultivable land as per state/UT land records. Aadhaar, bank account, and eKYC are mandatory. Family includes husband, wife, and minor children jointly owning land. Exclusions: Institutional landholders, constitutional post holders, ministers, MPs, MLAs, mayors, district panchayat chairpersons, government employees (except Class IV, MTS, Group D), pensioners with monthly pension ≥ ₹10,000, income tax payers, professionals, and NRIs. Steps to apply: Online - Visit PM-KISAN portal, register under 'Farmers Corner', enter details, upload documents, complete e-KYC, submit application. Offline - Visit nearest CSC or agriculture office, fill form, submit documents, CSC official processes e-KYC. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Income Support. Tags: pm-kisan, kisan samman nidhi, farmer support, income supplement, DBT, agriculture scheme, direct benefit transfer, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: No. Location coverage: All India. Crop coverage: All crops.
benefits_disbursement_mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)

metadata.description: Affordable crop insurance scheme for farmers, covering losses due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.

embedding_text: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY). Affordable crop insurance scheme for farmers, covering losses due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases. Objective: Provide affordable crop insurance to farmers, protecting against losses from natural calamities, pests, and diseases. Benefits: Farmers pay 1.5% to 5% of the insured sum as premium depending on crop type. Full crop value insured. Claims cover yield loss, post-harvest loss, localized calamities, and prevented sowing. Compensation is paid via DBT, usually within 3 months of crop cutting. Eligibility: All farmers (loanee or non-loanee), including sharecroppers and tenant farmers, cultivating notified crops in notified areas. Aadhaar and bank account are mandatory. Participation is voluntary. Exclusions: Crops not notified/insured in that season/area, late applicants, non-agricultural landholders, losses due to avoidable risks. Steps to apply: Online - Visit PMFBY portal, register/login, fill details, upload documents, submit application. Offline - Visit nearest bank, CSC, or insurance agent, fill form, attach documents, submit with premium. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Insurance. Tags: pmfby, fasal bima, crop insurance, agriculture insurance, government scheme, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: Yes. Location coverage: All India (notified areas and crops). Crop coverage: Food crops, oilseeds, notified horticultural/commercial crops.
benefits_disbursement_mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)

metadata.description: Financial assistance scheme by Rajasthan government for farmers to install barbed wire fencing, protecting crops from stray animals and enabling group applications for higher subsidy.

embedding_text: Kantedar Tarbandi Yojana (Rajasthan Fencing Scheme). Financial assistance scheme by Rajasthan government for farmers to install barbed wire fencing, protecting crops from stray animals and enabling group applications for higher subsidy. Objective: Provide financial assistance to farmers for installing barbed wire fencing around their fields to protect crops from stray animals. Benefits: Up to 60% subsidy (maximum ₹48,000 for small/marginal farmers, ₹40,000 for others); group applications can get up to 70%. Subsidy is transferred directly to the bank account after inspection. Eligibility: Permanent residents of Rajasthan owning at least 0.5 hectare (1.5 hectare for individuals in non-ST areas) of cultivable land. Groups of 10+ farmers with at least 5 hectares collectively can apply for higher subsidy. Special benefits for small/marginal farmers. Applicant must not have availed fencing subsidy under other schemes for the same land. Exclusions: Landholding less than required minimum area, applicants availing similar benefit from other schemes for same field. Steps to apply: Online - Register/login on Rajasthan SSO portal, select RAJ-KISAN, fill details, Aadhaar authentication, upload documents, submit application. Offline - Visit nearest agriculture extension office or e-Mitra centre, fill form, attach documents, submit. Category: Agriculture Infrastructure, Subcategory: Fencing. Tags: tarbandi, fencing, rajasthan, agriculture scheme, barbed wire, field protection, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: Yes. Location coverage: Rajasthan. Crop coverage: All crops.

embedding_text: Diggy Yojana (Rajasthan Water Storage Tank Scheme). Rajasthan government scheme providing up to 85% subsidy for farmers to construct water storage tanks (diggi) for irrigation, with mandatory drip/sprinkler installation. Objective: Promote construction of water storage tanks ('diggi') for irrigation by providing subsidies to eligible farmers. Benefits: 75% subsidy (max ₹3,00,000) for general farmers; 85% (max ₹3,40,000) for small and marginal farmers. Subsidy is transferred directly to the bank account upon approval. Eligibility: Rajasthan resident, farmer by occupation, owning at least 0.5 hectare irrigated agricultural land. Only practicing, land-owning farmers are eligible. Mandatory installation of drip/sprinkler system. Exclusions: Non-residents of Rajasthan, landholding less than 0.5 hectare, non-irrigated land, applicants who begin construction before administrative approval. Steps to apply: Online - Register/login on Rajasthan SSO portal, select Diggy Yojana, Aadhaar authentication, fill form, upload documents, submit application. metadata.description: Weather-based crop insurance scheme offering protection to farmers against financial loss from adverse weather, with DBT-based compensation.

embedding_text: Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS). Weather-based crop insurance scheme offering protection to farmers against financial loss from adverse weather, with DBT-based compensation. Objective: To provide protection to farmers against financial losses due to adverse weather conditions affecting crop yield. Benefits: Farmers pay 1.5% to 5% of sum insured depending on crop type; remainder is subsidized. Full coverage based on scale of finance. Compensation is paid for losses due to deviations in weather parameters like rainfall, temperature, humidity, or wind speed. Claims are settled quickly based on certified weather data, without field inspection, via DBT. Eligibility: All farmers (loanee and non-loanee), including sharecroppers and tenant farmers, growing notified crops in notified areas. Aadhaar and bank account required. Voluntary participation. Exclusions: Non-notified crops or areas, late applications, losses unrelated to weather deviations. Steps to apply: Online - Register on official RWBCIS/PMFBY portal, enter land and crop details, upload documents, and submit. Offline - Apply via nearest bank, CSC, or agent with form and documents. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Weather-Based Insurance. Tags: rwbcis, weather insurance, crop insurance, agriculture scheme, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: Yes. Location coverage: All India (notified areas; varies by state/season). Crop coverage: Food crops, oilseeds, and seasonal horticultural/commercial crops.
benefits_disbursement_mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)

embedding_text: Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme (CPIS). Insurance scheme for coconut palms providing risk cover against natural calamities, pests, and diseases with premium subsidy support. Objective: To provide risk cover to coconut growers against natural and other perils leading to the death of coconut palms. Benefits: Farmers pay 25% of the subsidized premium, while state governments and the Coconut Development Board cover the rest. Insurance sum ranges from ₹900 to ₹1,750 per palm based on age. Compensation is provided for damage due to storms, fire, pests, and disease, with direct bank transfer. Eligibility: Coconut growers or grower societies with healthy palms aged 4 to 60 years. Aadhaar and bank account required. Voluntary participation. Exclusions: Palms under 4 or over 60 years, pre-existing damage, intentional harm. Steps to apply: Offline - Visit designated bank or nodal office, fill form with land and tree details, attach documents, and pay farmer share of premium. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Crop Insurance. Tags: coconut, cpis, insurance, agriculture, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: Yes. Location coverage: Major coconut-producing states/UTs. Crop coverage: Coconut palms aged 4 to 60 years.

embedding_text: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop (PMKSY-PDMC). Central scheme providing financial assistance for micro irrigation systems to enhance water use efficiency at farm level through drip and sprinkler irrigation. Objective: Enhancing water use efficiency at the farm level through Micro Irrigation (Drip and Sprinkler Irrigation System) and supports micro-level water storage, and water conservation/management activities. Benefits: 55% subsidy for small and marginal farmers, 45% for other farmers. Financial assistance for installation of drip or sprinkler irrigation systems. Support for water harvesting structures, water lifting devices, and farm pond digging. Payment through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT). Eligibility: All farmers of states and Union Territories are eligible. Must be citizen of India. Subsidy limited to 5 hectares per beneficiary. Aadhaar and bank account required. Voluntary participation. Exclusions: Area exceeding 5 hectares per beneficiary, non-BIS marked systems/components, non-citizens. Steps to apply: Offline - Contact Block/District Agriculture Office through Gram Panchayat or call Kisan Call Centre, collect application form, fill details, attach documents, submit to designated authority. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Irrigation. Tags: pmksy, pdmc, micro irrigation, drip irrigation, sprinkler, water efficiency, agriculture, 2025. Status: active. Voluntary: Yes. Location coverage: All India. Crop coverage: Water-intensive crops like sugarcane, banana, cotton, and field crops.
benefits_disbursement_mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)

metadata.description: Kisan Credit Card Scheme offers short-term credit up to ₹3 lakh at low effective interest rates with flexible repayment terms for farmers across India.

embedding_text: Kisan Credit Card (KCC) Scheme. Central sector scheme implemented by banks with Government of India interest subvention. Objective: Provide timely short-term credit for cultivation, post-harvest expenses, allied activities, and other agricultural needs at affordable interest rates. Benefits: Credit limit up to ₹3 lakh per farmer, flexible withdrawal as needed within sanctioned limit, interest subvention of 2% and prompt repayment incentive of 3% reducing effective rate to 4% per annum. Eligibility: All farmers—owner cultivators, tenant farmers, sharecroppers, and oral lessees—engaged in agriculture or allied activities. Aadhaar, bank account, and eKYC required; voluntary enrolment. Exclusions: Defaulters of bank loans and non-agricultural borrowers. Steps to apply: Online – Visit bank’s KCC portal or PM-Kisan-linked KCC application, fill form with Aadhaar, landholding, crop details, upload documents, submit and track online. Offline – Visit nearest bank branch, fill KCC application form, submit copies of documents, bank verifies, sanctions limit, issues KCC card/loan account. embedding_text: Amma Farm Prosperity Through Farmers (Amma FPTF) Scheme. State-level direct income support scheme for small and marginal farmers in Tamil Nadu, offering ₹6,000 per annum paid in two installments of ₹3,000 every six months through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT). The goal is to provide income support and incentivize best practices among eligible cultivators. Aadhaar, bank account, and e-KYC are mandatory. Family defined as joint or individual landholders as per state records. Exclusions include institutional landholders, government servants (except Class IV), high pensioners, income tax payers, and professionals. Applications open year-round online or offline. Benefits: ₹6,000 per year to each eligible farmer family directly to their account. Category: Agriculture, Subcategory: Income Support. Tags: amma scheme, fptf, farmer support, income supplement, DBT, tamil nadu agriculture, direct benefit transfer, 2025. Status: active. State-specific: Yes. Location coverage: Tamil Nadu. Crop coverage: All crops.

metadata.description: Tamil Nadu’s 2025 Nutrient-sensitive Agriculture Mission provides free vegetable, fruit, and pulse seed kits to boost household and farm nutrition; covers crop inputs and expert support for cultivation, aims at greater diet diversity and smallholder income.

embedding_text: Nutrient-sensitive Agriculture Mission (NSAM). State-level scheme launched in Tamil Nadu in 2025 providing free vegetable seed kits, fruit sapling kits, and pulse kits to smallholder and home garden households. The program supports diversified nutrient-rich crop cultivation across the state, especially for low-income and marginal farming families. Components include kit distribution, area expansion of vegetable and fruit crops, technical support for trellised vegetable farming, intensification of pulse cultivation, and establishment of pulse and mushroom units. Coverage aims at nutritional security, crop diversity, and rural income support. Tags: nutrition, vegetable seed kit, crop diversification, Tamil Nadu, agriculture, 2025.

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
funding source: Funded jointly by Government of India and State Governments (core central share 60–75%, with state share)
purpose or objective of scheme: Achieve convergence of investments in irrigation at the field level, expand micro-irrigation and efficient water management to ensure ‘Per Drop More Crop’.
Scheme coverage area: Nationwide (including all southern states and districts)
Crops covered: All irrigated and unirrigated crops benefiting from assured irrigation

metadata.description: Major irrigation scheme promoting micro-irrigation and field-level convergence of water investments, ensuring efficient use for all crops—high success in South Indian sugarcane, horticulture, and rice paddy districts.

embedding_text: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY): Flagship central plan for expanding and modernising irrigation—converging micro-irrigation and water saving practices for better productivity and resilience, with large-scale adoption in South India.

name: National Mission on Natural Farming (NMNF)
funding source: Jointly funded by Government of India and states (core central share 60%; state 40%)
purpose or objective of scheme: Promote natural (chemical-free) farming practices, reduce input cost, improve soil health, and enhance farmers' incomes by supporting bio-inputs and ecologically sustainable techniques.
Scheme coverage area: All states; southern districts prioritized as part of demonstration clusters
Crops covered: All crops (focus on sustainable/alternative agricultural practices)

metadata.description: New flagship centrally sponsored scheme from 2024 supporting clusters of farmers to adopt natural, chemical-free, and eco-friendly practices—models statewide with many South Indian demonstration zones. Technical, financial, and bio-input support.

Grants for composting, vermicompost, and crop residue management.
